intro: Pultenaea aculeata, commonly known as the prickly pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often thorny stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs. Pultenaea aculeata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
